item.title: Forgetting is a Feature
item.description: If our brains could remember everything then nothing would be important. Our brains would be an even more calamitous place than it already is. The fact that we forget things we don’t use regularly is actually a feature to make room for the new things you will learn....

item.title: In writing, what the author mean't is irrelevant
item.description: This is an especially challenging trap for me as someone who doesn’t find writing easy. I often find myself in a scenario where someone reads (usually my wife) something I wrote and we discuss it, only for me to find out what I meant and what I wrote were not the same....

item.title: The importance of Primary Actions
item.description: “Use constraints so that the user feels as if there is only one possible thing to do — the right thing, of course.” Constraints work by reducing alternatives for users. A well-constructed system will present users as few alternatives as possible at each step....

item.title: Your phone is the constant enemy to achieving your goals
item.description: Doomscrolling The hour before work is the “Golden Hour” for productivity. Like the last hour before sunset in photography, it’s the perfect conditions to succeed There is a two hour window in each day where you are most productive....

item.title: Increasing your "luck"
People with repeated success increase their chances of success by taking more shots
item.description: Luck Successful People People with repeat success Increasing your visibility This has the net effect of: Increasing your “luck” Things to do: Put stuff out into the world Take more action Do more things Meet more people Go to more events Blog about your startup Produce things & publish them Get Feedback References from Ali Abdaal

item.title: Key Reasons People Play Video Games
item.description: They are a temporary escape They are social They are a challenge They demonstrate constant measurable growth References Escaping video game addiction Cam Adair at TEDxBoulder...

item.title: If you are struggling with Video Game Addiction, look for ways to get what you are getting out of those video games through other sources
item.description: For me, it was about finding another challenge and a way to see constant measurable growth. A key thing that kept me from breaking the addiction earlier was the social time I got gaming with my cousin....

item.title: Have a clear process for how you separate the end of the workday and the rest of your life
item.description: Work Life Balance Check your emails for any last urgent items. Check for any Product Reviews Is the Task Inbox processed? Update your todo list of unfinished items. Make sure every item in your todo list is scheduled to be done at some point....

item.title: Avoid a second cup of coffee for better sleep
item.description: Sleep Afternoon Coffee / Afternoon Tea Second cup of coffee is wrecking my sleep tonight. I think it is a combination of nerves, caffeine and lack of exercise. I should promise myself to not have a 2nd cup of coffee without exercise, and ideally no 2nd coffee at all....

item.title: Think with paper and store conclusions digitally
item.description: Think with paper and store conclusions digitally Creative Thought url: https://decoding.io/2021/05/think-with-paper-and-store-conclusions-digitally/ There is quite a big difference between paper and digital tools, but they can complement each other nicely. You can use paper to get an order in random ideas by doing doodles, wireframes, mindmaps, diagrams, or what have you....

item.title: Have capture tools everywhere
item.description: Creative Thought Stumbled upon https://decoding.io/2021/05/refactoring-my-gtd-system-part-2-the-capture-wallet/ today and it led me down the path of: Have Capture Tools everywhere. I’ve found on a number of occasions I have a good idea or at least something that keeps me from sleeping and being able to get it out of my head and on to paper would be preferred....
